item.title: Wheel of Fortune」の司会を40年間務めたPat Sajak氏は、9月に始まるゲーム番組の41シーズン終了後の2024年に引退する予定だ（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Pat Sajak, the host of Wheel of Fortune for 40 years, plans to retire in 2024 after the game show's 41st season which begins in September  —  Pat Sajak, who has hosted the hit game show Wheel of Fortune since Ronald Reagan was president, will retire next year.

item.title: 情報筋の話：Netflixが今秋、初のスポーツイベントをライブ配信する方向で交渉中、プロゴルファーやF1ドライバーによるセレブリティゴルフトーナメントを開催（Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Netflix is in talks to livestream its first sporting event this fall, a celebrity golf tournament with professional golfers and Formula One drivers  —  Tournament would feature celebrities from Formula One series ‘Drive to Survive’ and golf program ‘Full Swing’

item.title: 英語を話せない移民のために、YouTuberが情報の空白を埋めている。Newsmaxなどの極右雑誌をベトナム語に翻訳している人もいる（Lam Thuy Vo/The Markup）
item.description:
Lam Thuy Vo / The Markup:
How YouTubers are filling information voids for immigrants who don't speak English, including one who translates far-right outlets like Newsmax into Vietnamese  —  How one Vietnamese community depends on YouTube for news, and what that tells us about the unmet needs of immigrant enclaves

item.title: CNNの次期CEOが直面する構造的・経営的課題、視聴率低迷やマイクロマネジメントなど、WBD CEO David Zaslavによる考察（Jeremy Barr／Washington Post）。
item.description:
Jeremy Barr / Washington Post:
A look at the structural and management challenges facing the next CEO of CNN, including slumping ratings and micromanagement by WBD CEO David Zaslav  —  Even beyond the fired CEO's programming blunders, the cable-news giant is facing industry-wide challenges and corporate hurdles that could make it a hard role to fill.

item.title: MrBeastことJimmy Donaldsonが、利他的な行為や、時には文字通り慈善行為として加入するピッチングなど、その不条理な行為でバイラルセンセーションを起こした理由（Max Read/New York Times)
item.description:
Max Read / New York Times:
How Jimmy Donaldson, aka MrBeast, became a viral sensation for his absurd acts of altruism and pitching subscribing as an act of charity, sometimes literally  —  Jimmy Donaldson, a.k.a. MrBeast, has become a viral sensation for his absurd acts of altruism.  Why do so many people think he's evil?

item.title: ジェフ・ベゾスは2023年にワシントン・ポストの運営により深く関与していると、スタッフが1月にフレッド・ライアンの経営について懸念を示した後に関係者が語っている（New York Times）。
item.description:
New York Times:
Jeff Bezos has been more involved in The Washington Post's operations in 2023, a source says after staff raised concerns in January about Fred Ryan's management  —  Patty Stonesifer, the former chief executive of Martha's Table, will be The Post's interim chief executive.

item.title: かつて尊敬される60ミニッツ特派員だったララ・ローガンが、2013年に報じたベンガジの記事をCBSが公に否定した後、いかにして陰謀論者になったか（Elaina Plott Calabro/The Atlantic）。
item.description:
Elaina Plott Calabro / The Atlantic:
How Lara Logan, once a respected 60 Minutes correspondent, became a conspiracy theorist after CBS publicly disavowed a Benghazi story she had reported in 2013  —  Lara Logan was once a respected 60 Minutes correspondent.  Now she trades in conspiracy theories that even far-right media disavow.

Sources: the EU is set to hit Google with a formal antitrust complaint regarding the company's ad tech, with a statement of objections coming as soon as June 14  —  Google is set to be hit with a formal antitrust complaint from the European Union that could pave the way for massive fines …

item.title: ワシントンポストの発行人兼CEOのフレッド・ライアンが8月に退社する予定で、ゲイツ財団の創設者であるパティ・ストンシファーCEOを暫定CEOに指名した（ワシントンポスト）。
item.description:
Washington Post:
The Washington Post publisher and CEO Fred Ryan plans to leave in August and the outlet names Gates Foundation founding CEO Patty Stonesifer as its interim CEO  —  Ryan, chief executive of The Post for most of the decade since Jeff Bezos bought it, will lead the new Center on Public Civility at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Foundation

item.title: The Athleticは記者の4%にあたる〜20人を解雇し、20人以上の記者に新たな任務を与える予定で、1チーム1人の記者から幅広いカバーにシフトする（Katie Robertson/New York Times）。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
The Athletic lays off ~20, or ~4% of its journalists, and plans to give 20+ reporters new assignments, shifting from one reporter per team to broader coverage  —  Nearly 20 journalists will lose their jobs and more than 20 others will be moved to new assignments.

Time dropped its paywall on June 1, ending 250K digital subscriptions, and says the outlet has 1.3M print subscribers and revenue grew 19% YoY to $200M in 2022  —  Earlier this month, the publisher eliminated its digital subscription business  —  The general news publisher …

item.title: GroupM、2023年の世界の広告費は前年比5.9%増の$874.5B、米国の政治広告を除く、デジタルは前年比8.4%増、2009年以来最も低調と予想（Megan Graham/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Megan Graham / Wall Street Journal:
GroupM expects global ad spending to grow 5.9% YoY to $874.5B in 2023, excluding US political ads, including digital growing 8.4% YoY, the slowest since 2009  —  GroupM expects ad spending to grow 5.9% this year to $874.5 billion, excluding U.S. political advertising
